175.title: Malaysia to reopen its borders from April 1 with quarantine waiver
175.article_body: Malaysia is set to fully reopen its borders from April 1 and allow quarantine-free entry to vaccinated visitors, PM Ismail Sabri Yaakob said on Tuesday. Visitors will, however, need to take an RT-PCR test two days before departure and a rapid antigen test after arrival in the country. Additionally, Malaysian nationals will be able to resume international travel.

176.title: India to resume regular international flights from March 27 after 2 years
176.article_body: The Centre has decided to resume scheduled commercial international passenger flights to and from India from March 27 after two years. "International operations shall be subject to strict adherence to Ministry of Health guidelines for international travel," the Civil Aviation Ministry said on Tuesday. The restrictions were in place due to coronavirus pandemic.

177.title: 2 million people have fled Ukraine since start of Russian invasion: UN
177.article_body: The UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) Filippo Grandi on Tuesday said that two million people have fled Ukraine since Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24. It represents the fastest-growing refugee crisis in Europe since World War II. Grandi warned that a second wave of refugees from Ukraine is likely to be more vulnerable than the first wave.

178.title: Australia-Pakistan score 1,187 runs for 14 wickets, use 16 bowlers as Test ends in a draw
178.article_body: Australia and Pakistan aggregated 1,187 runs in the first Test in Rawalpindi which witnessed 16 bowlers being used across the five days. The match witnessed four hundreds and four fifties, with Pakistan opener Imam-ul-Haq slamming two hundreds in the match. The match was Australia's first in Pakistan after 24 years.

179.title: Norway wealth fund puts Adani Ports, 2 others on its watch list
179.article_body: Norway's sovereign wealth fund has put Adani Ports, Canada's Bombardier and South Korea's Hyundai Glovis on its watch list for possible exclusion from investment due to ethical concerns. It said Adani Ports has been put on the watch list for its possible contribution to "serious violations" of human rights because of its involvement in building a port terminal in Myanmar.

180.title: Working hours of Mumbai women police personnel reduced to 8 hours
180.article_body: On the occasion of International Women's Day, the newly-appointed Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey has ordered that women police personnel will be getting eight-hour shifts from Tuesday. The officials reportedly said the new shorter duty time for women personnel will be in force till further orders. The directive aims to help women personnel maintain a healthy work-home balance, they said.

181.title: Putin is a spent force in the world: UK Defence Secretary
181.article_body: British Defence Secretary Ben Wallace said that Russian President Vladimir Putin is "a spent force in the world" whatever happens in Ukraine. "This will be Putin's end," Wallace added. "No one will be taking his phone calls in the long term. He has exhausted his army...He's reducing his economy to zero...he has to take responsibility for that," Wallace further said.

182.title: Zelenskyy recalls Ukrainian peacekeepers from UN missions to fight Russia
182.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has signed a decree recalling Ukrainian peacekeepers, along with their weapons and hardware, participating in UN missions to assist in the war effort. The move is aimed at strengthening Ukrainian Army against Russian aggression, Deputy Head of Ukrainian President's Office Andrii Sybiha said, publishing the order. Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24.

183.title: Fire breaks out at scrap godown in Thane, no injuries reported
183.article_body: Fire department officials confirmed that a fire broke out at a scrap godown located near the HP petrol pump on the Shilphata-Mahape road in Maharashtra's Thane on Tuesday. While no casualties or injuries have been reported so far, fire tenders were immediately rushed to the spot to control the fire.

184.title: Shell to stop buying oil, gas from Russia, apologises for buying cargo after invasion
184.article_body: British oil giant Shell has announced that it will stop purchasing Russian oil and gas, with CEO Ben van Beurden apologising for buying a cargo of Russian crude oil after Ukraine invasion. "As an immediate first step, we will stop all spot purchases of Russian crude oil, shut service stations, aviation fuels and lubricants operations in Russia," Shell said.

185.title: All sanction options against Russia being considered: Netherlands
185.article_body: Netherlands Foreign Minister Wopke Hoekstra said on Tuesday that all sanction options against Russia are under consideration, including those on Russian energy. Hoekstra added, however, all EU nations should be able to "bear the burden" if they're imposed. EU buys 45% of its gas, around one-third of its oil and nearly half of its coal from Russia, Reuters reported.

186.title: Ashwin is much more difficult to face than Harbhajan: Gautam Gambhir
186.article_body: Sharing his opinion on the off-spinner who is more difficult to face between Ravichandran Ashwin and Harbhajan Singh, Gautam Gambhir named Ashwin as he is "far more" accurate and tough because of his speed variations. "As a batter, I would hate to face Ashwin," said Gambhir. "Harbhajan was more beautiful to watch," stated the former Indian cricketer.

187.title: Ukraine's President Zelenskyy to address British parliament
187.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday will virtually address the British parliament. It will be the first time a foreign president addresses the House of Commons. "Every parliamentarian wants to hear directly from the president, who will be speaking to us live from Ukraine, so this is an important opportunity for the House," Speaker Sir Lindsay Hoyle said.

188.title: President Kovind confers 'Nari Shakti Puraskar' on 29 women
188.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind conferred the 'Nari Shakti Puraskar' on 29 women for 2020 and 2021, on International Women's Day on Tuesday. An initiative of Women and Child Development Ministry, the award recognises exceptional work towards women's empowerment. Social entrepreneur Anita Gupta, tribal activist Ushaben Dineshbhai Vasava and innovator Nasira Akhter, among others, were the latest awardees.

189.title: Raghavan is among the best filmmakers of Hindi cinema today: Sanjay
189.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor said that he is looking forward to working under filmmaker Sriram Raghavan's vision in the film 'Merry Christmas'. "Raghavan is one of the best filmmakers of Hindi cinema today," Sanjay added. The film also features Katrina Kaif and Vijay Sethupathi. "I have been in awe of his style of storytelling ever since I saw 'Badlapur'," Sanjay stated.

190.title: There's lot of diverse content across Hollywood today: Kal Penn
190.article_body: Actor Kal Penn stated there's a lot of diverse content in Hollywood currently than there was a decade ago "More great projects with...interesting, funny...diverse stories [are there] for audiences to enjoy, like 'Hot Mess Holiday'," he added. When asked about working in Bollywood, Penn said, "I'm trying to produce more in Bollywood, there's an exciting opportunity with the OTT platforms."

191.title: Clear advantages in a central bank driven digital currency: FM
191.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government sees "clear advantages in a central bank driven digital currency". She added that the digital rupee is a conscious call taken in consultation with RBI and that the government expects the digital currency to come out from RBI this year itself. "I see a possibility for revenue in [digital currency]," she said.

192.title: 4 dead, 2 injured after car collides with truck in UP's Kanpur
192.article_body: Four people were killed and two others were seriously injured after a car collided with a truck in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur district, police said. The incident occurred on Monday night when the car driver tried to overtake a vehicle but collided with the speeding truck coming from the opposite direction. The car was going towards Ghatampur, police said.

193.title: Apple's Russia exit may cost $3 mn/day in iPhone sales: Report
193.article_body: Apple might lose at least $3 million in iPhone sales revenue daily or $1.14 billion annually as it announced to pull out from the Russian market, Lithuania-based online shopping portal Burga reported. Apple accounts for 15% of the Russian smartphone sales to rank third overall. South Korea's Samsung occupies the top position with 34%.

194.title: Kumble would've taken over 1,000 int'l wickets with DRS: Kohli's coach
194.article_body: Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said Anil Kumble would have taken more than 1,000 wickets in international cricket if he had DRS, having retired with 956 wickets. "During my time..., if the ball struck the pads of the batter while...on the front foot, the umpire would...give it not out," added Rajkumar. Kumble is India's top wicket-taker in Tests.

195.title: School uniforms worth ₹351 cr distributed to students during COVID in MP
195.article_body: Madhya Pradesh government distributed school uniforms worth ₹351 crore to over 1.17 crore students across 50 districts of the state during COVID-19 pandemic in financial year 2020-21, School Education Minister Inder Singh Parmar said. While "radio school" (online) was started for Classes 1 to 8, students from Classes 9 to 12 studied under "Hamara Ghar Hamara Vidyalaya" plan, he added.

196.title: To say that govt controlled oil prices due to polls is incorrect: Puri
196.article_body: Petroleum and Natural Gas Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Tuesday said oil prices are determined by global prices and "to say that the government had controlled oil prices due to elections is not correct". "We'll take decisions in the best interest of our citizens," he added. This comes after global oil prices reached close to the $140/barrel mark on Monday.

197.title: IMD issues yellow alert in parts of Maharashtra, Gujarat & MP
197.article_body: The IMD issued a yellow alert for Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat and Maharashtra forecasting thunderstorms for the next two days. The wind confluence and a trough in easterlies run from the southeast Arabian Sea off Kerala coast to Konkan coast in lower tropospheric levels and these conditions are likely to bring thunderstorms and rains in these states, the weather agency said.

198.title: Raipur journalist held for political satire now charged with prostitution
198.article_body: Nilesh Sharma, a journalist who was earlier arrested by Raipur Police for allegedly writing satirical articles on Congress MLAs, has now been charged with three new sections. According to the police, they have found pornographic content in Sharma's phone and have sent him to jail charging him with sections under the IT Act and prevention of immoral trafficking law.

199.title: Dish TV to move SAT against SEBI order to disclose its AGM voting results
199.article_body: Dish TV on Tuesday said it will move the Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) against SEBI's interim order directing Dish TV to disclose its annual general meeting's (AGM) voting results. SEBI had ordered Dish TV on Monday to disclose AGM results within 24 hours. It also issued show cause notices and directed depositories to freeze Demat accounts of the company's directors.

200.title: How will the new UPI work on feature phones and in offline mode?
200.article_body: To use RBI's UPI123Pay, users need to link their bank account with their feature phones and set up a UPI pin with a debit card. They can call an Interactive Voice Response number to transfer money. They can also use a missed call payment feature to send money to a merchant/shop or tap their phones on a sound-based payments device.

201.title: 15th round of India and China military talks on March 11: Reports
201.article_body: India and China will hold the 15th round of Corps Commander-level talks on March 11, reports claimed on Tuesday. The talks will be held at the Chushul Moldo meeting point in India. The 14 rounds of talks held so far have led to a resolution in the North and South Bank of Pangong Tso, Galwan and Gogra Hot Spring areas.

202.title: Bye bye, good riddance: Simon Jordan on Chelsea's Russian owner Abramovich
202.article_body: Terming Chelsea's Russian owner Roman Abramovich as one of the "worst things" for English football, ex-Crystal Palace owner Simon Jordan said, "[Abramovich's legacy] is awful...good riddance, bye bye." "He's part of a regime that's got a Mafioso boss that's gone mad...in Vladimir Putin," added Jordan. Swiss billionaire Hansjorg Wyss had earlier called Abramovich one of Putin's closest friends.

203.title: Swiggy hires JP Morgan, I-Sec for $800 mn-$1 billion IPO: Reports
203.article_body: Swiggy has hired two investment banks JP Morgan and ICICI Securities for the launch of its $800 million to $1 billion IPO, media reports said citing sources. Swiggy plans to offer about 10% stake in the IPO, which may be a mix of primary and secondary offering. It may file the DRHP with SEBI by June.

204.title: Bengaluru Police detects 7 cases of house break-ins & thefts
204.article_body: DCP (Bengaluru's Whitefield) S Girish took to Twitter on Monday and informed that Bellandur Police detected seven "important" cases of house break-ins and thefts in the city. Girish tweeted that the Bellandur Police was rewarded with appreciation certificates over the same. He also informed that the police recovered 500 grams of gold jewellery from the possession of an offender.

205.title: Income Tax raids premises linked to Aaditya Thackeray's aide
205.article_body: The Income Tax department carried out searches on premises linked to Shiv Sena leader Rrahul Narain Kanal, who is a close aide of Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray. The raid was conducted in connection with alleged tax evasion by BMC Standing Committee's Chairman Yashwant Jadhav. Kanal is a member of BMC's Education Committee and trustee of Shri Sai Baba Sansthan Trust.

206.title: 694 Indian students stuck in Ukraine's Sumy being evacuated: Govt
206.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has confirmed that the evacuation process for Indian students stranded in Ukraine's Sumy city has started. The minister said, "Last night, I checked with the control room, 694 Indian students were remaining in Sumy. Today, they have all left in buses for Poltava." This comes after Russia announced ceasefire in five cities including Sumy.

207.title: For privilege we have, my father works hard every day: Big B's daughter Shweta
207.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan's daughter Shweta Nanda said that being in public eye is not easy. "For all privilege we have, my father, who will turn 80 this year, works hard every day...I have seen what goes behind everything. He wakes up at 5...is on the set, which is a tough world...Then you are picked on for every thing," she added.

208.title: Not going to play Tests again, so no point in playing first-class cricket: Finch
208.article_body: Australia limited-overs captain Aaron Finch, who last played a first-class match in 2019, has said he doesn't see any point in playing Sheffield Shield cricket again as he's not going to play Test cricket anymore. "Unless you're pushing for a Test match, I don't really see the point," he stated. Finch last played a Test match in December 2018.

209.title: Ukraine’s youngest MP aged 26 takes up arms to fight Russia; posts pics with AK-47
209.article_body: Amid the war in the country, Ukraine's youngest Member of Parliament Sviatoslav Yurash has taken up arms to fight Russia. The 26-year-old has been posting pictures of him with an AK-47 assault rifle looped over one shoulder. "This is defining moment for our nation. We either fight and survive, to live on to next generation, or we fall," he said.

210.title: Wheelchair-bound B'luru professor accuses Air India of denying boarding
210.article_body: A wheelchair-bound professor at Bengaluru's Indian Statistical Institute has alleged that he was "humiliated" and denied boarding an Air India flight at Bengaluru airport on Monday. The professor, Kaushik Kumar Majumdar, alleged the Kolkata-bound flight's pilot asked him to remove his wheelchair battery. However, he told the pilot that it was "impossible," following this, he was denied boarding.

211.title: I went through a tough time after my father's death: Fardeen on Feroz Khan
211.article_body: Speaking about what kept him away from films for over a decade, actor Fardeen said he was going through a tough time after his father, actor Feroz Khan's death due to lung cancer in 2009. "I needed some time off...I had a little bit of a health scare myself in 2009 just a few months after his death," he added.

212.title: Co-star got scared, I can't remember: Bob on heart attack on 'Better...' set
212.article_body: American actor Bob Odenkirk who suffered heart attack on sets of 'Better Call Saul' in July last year said he does not remember anything about it. "She [co-star Rhea Seehorn] got scared, I wasn't scared...Can't help but think about it fair amount," Odenkirk said, adding, "Reaction I got from public and friends, it all affected me...it still will...and continues to."

213.title: Central agencies have become BJP's publicity machinery: Aaditya Thackeray
213.article_body: Reacting to the Income Tax department raids on premises of MVA leaders, Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray said that the central probe agencies have in a way become "publicity machinery" of BJP. "Maharashtra in the past has witnessed invasion. This is an invasion by Delhi," he added. "Maharashtra will not be scared nor will it bow down," Thackeray further said.

214.title: Ukraine starts evacuating civilians from Sumy, video shows people inside buses
214.article_body: Ukraine has begun evacuating civilians from Sumy as Russia opened humanitarian corridors. "We call on Russia to uphold...ceasefire commitment, to refrain from activities that endanger the lives of people and to allow the delivery of humanitarian aid," wrote Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs. "We call on Russia to agree on other humanitarian corridors," it tweeted while sharing a video.

215.title: SP candidate keeps vigil on strong room in Meerut through binoculars
215.article_body:
SP candidate from Hastinapur constituency in Meerut district, Yogesh Verma, has been 
camping outside the vote counting site at the Agriculture University in Meerut and is keeping an eye on EVM strong room with binoculars to prevent "mishandling". "SP chief has ordered to keep an eye on EVM strong room...We will work in three shifts of eight hours," Verma said.

216.title: Warne brought spin as attacking commodity to cricketing world: Ashwin
216.article_body: India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has said that Shane Warne, who passed away last week, brought spin as an attacking commodity to the cricketing world. "He was a colourful character, he redefined bowling, took more than 1000 international wickets," added Ashwin on his YouTube channel. He further said, "Warne was a maestro...lived his life to the fullest."

217.title: BJP will be ousted the day people find a viable alternative: Mamata
217.article_body: West Bengal CM and TMC chief Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday said the BJP will be ousted from power the day people find an alternative. Speaking at TMC's organisational meet, Banerjee said opposition parties should come together to form the alternative force needed to oust BJP from power. TMC is supporting BJP rival Samajwadi Party in the ongoing UP Assembly polls.

218.title: NASA's Curiosity rover captures photo of tiny mineral flower on Mars
218.article_body: NASA shared a close-up picture of a tiny, flower-like mineral deposit on the surface of Mars captured by Curiosity rover. "It's a concretion, eroded from sedimentary rock that was cemented by mineral-rich groundwater," the rover's Twitter handle informed. The centimetre wide branching rock resembles a sponge or coral but is lifeless. It was likely formed when water still covered Mars.

219.title: Police create green corridor for transportation of live organs in Hyd
219.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Traffic Police created a green corridor for the transportation of a live heart and lungs from Kamineni Hospital in LB Nagar to KIMS Hospital in Begumpet. The ambulance covered 17.6 kilometres within 16 minutes without traffic obstructions, police said. "Ambulance started from Kamineni Hospital at 10.01 hours and reached KIMS Hospital at 10.17 hours," police added.

220.title: Sure that people have voted against arrogant govt: Cong's Hooda on exit poll
220.article_body: Reacting to the exit poll results of Assembly elections, Congress leader Deepender Hooda said, the party is sure that people have voted against the arrogant (central) government in all five states. "Congress will form government on its own in Uttarakhand, Punjab, Manipur and Goa. There'll be a change in UP and government will be formed with Congress' support," he added.

221.title: You'll always be my Hero: Rajkummar on his mother's 6th death anniversary
221.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao shared a post remembering his mother on her 6th death anniversary. Sharing a picture from his wedding with Patralekhaa, Rajkummar can be seen blowing a kiss to his mother's photo frame, he captioned it, "It's been six years Maa, since you left us but I know you are always there with me...You will always be my Hero."

222.title: May seek exception to EU sanctions on Russian gas & oil: Bulgaria PM
222.article_body: Bulgaria is supportive of EU sanctions on Russia but may seek an exception if they're imposed on Russian natural gas and oil supply, PM Kiril Petkov said on Monday. "We don't have...alternatives [for gas and oil imports] right now, we're too dependent," Petkov added. Over 60% of the fuel used in Bulgaria is reportedly produced by a Russia-owned oil refinery.

223.title: Intel's self-driving car unit Mobileye confidentially files for US IPO
223.article_body: Intel's self-driving car unit Mobileye confidentially filed for an initial public offering in the United States on Monday. The number of shares to be offered and the price range for the proposed offering have not yet been determined, Intel said. The chipmaker had originally purchased Israel-based company Mobileye in 2017 for $15.3 billion.

224.title: Puneeth's last movie 'James' to hit 4,000 screens on his birth anniversary
224.article_body: Late Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar's last film 'James' will be released in as many as 4,000 screens across India on his birth anniversary on March 17. The film will be released in Tamil, Hindi, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam languages. Puneeth is playing the role of a manager in a security company in the movie.

225.title: Cyberabad Traffic Police posts video of woman hit by 2-wheeler
225.article_body: The Cyberabad Traffic Police shared a video of a road accident in Moinabad X road. In the video, a speeding two-wheeler can be seen hitting a woman who was crossing the road. "Taking your eyes off the road for two seconds is a big deal!" the Cyberabad Traffic Police captioned the video.

226.title: Who is Inspector Madhulatha, the 1st woman SHO appointed in Hyd?
226.article_body: Inspector K Madhulatha took charge as the station house officer of Hyderabad's Lallaguda Police Station on International Women's Day on Tuesday. The 2002-batch officer is the first woman officer to lead a law and order police station in Hyderabad. The 42-year-old was also the first woman officer to head the IT Corridor Women Police Station in the city.

227.title: Delhi Police dedicates Defence Colony station to women to mark Women's Day
227.article_body: Delhi Police dedicated the Defence Colony Police Station to women officers on Tuesday to mark International Women's Day. "Whether it's a case, whether it's a call, whether it's a complainant, lady staff will handle it today," DCP South Benita Mary Jaikar said. All ranks right from the SHO to the division and patrolling staff will be women, she added.

228.title: TN minister's daughter seeks B'luru Police's protection for self, husband
228.article_body: Jayakalyani, the daughter of Tamil Nadu minister and DMK leader PK Sekar Babu, has sought protection from Bengaluru Police for herself and her husband Satish Kumar. She alleged her family is against their relationship and had got Satish arrested earlier when they tried getting married. "I suspect...my father [is] behind this," she said, adding that they got death threats too.

229.title: Kohli played 2011 WC semi against Pakistan despite neck and jaw pain: Ex-India physio
229.article_body: Former Team India physio Ashish Kaushik has revealed that Virat Kohli played the 2011 World Cup semi-final against Pakistan in Mohali despite neck and jaw pain. Kaushik added, "Kohli would take everything extremely lightly and somehow know...he can work through it." "His pain tolerance is phenomenal...Kohli has got a tremendous ability to endure pain and look for solutions," he stated.

230.title: M&A in their early days: Harsh Goenka as he shares childhood pic of Ambani brothers
230.article_body: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka has shared a childhood photograph of Mukesh Ambani and Anil Ambani on Twitter and wrote, "Two brothers in their early days...M&A." The picture shows the two brothers dressed in formal suits with garlands around their necks. "Mukesh Ambani's looks are always constant," a Twitter user reacted to the picture.

231.title: Dog peed right by me as I celebrated Best Actor award win: Nakuul
231.article_body: Nakuul Mehta, who bagged the Best Actor-Television award for his show 'Bade Achhe Lagte Hain 2', at the Indian Television Awards 2022, said he celebrated his win by having kathi roll on the streets of Mumbai. "Whilst a passing stray dog, peed right by me. Gentle reminder by...universe that...the world may still not give a shit about you," he added.

232.title: Edtech unicorn Emeritus raises $350 million from CPP Investments
232.article_body: Edtech unicorn Emeritus has raised $350 million in debt financing from Canada Pension Plan Investment Board through its subsidiary CPPIB Credit Investments. After the funding's completion, Emeritus claims that it will have raised more than $1 billion in debt and equity. CPP Investments also participated in Emeritus' $650 million funding last year, which pushed Emeritus' valuation to $3.2 billion.

233.title: 70-year-old man found dead at home in UP's Greater Noida
233.article_body: A 70-year-old man was found dead at his home in Habibpur village in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida on Monday morning, police said. "Prima facie it appears that the man was strangulated. However, a post mortem report will confirm the cause of death," police added. The victim was involved in a property dispute with some relatives, police further said.

234.title: David Warner does bhangra on field during match against Pakistan, video goes viral
234.article_body: A video of Australia opener David Warner doing bhangra on the field during first Test against Pakistan in Rawalpindi has gone viral. "The crowd and the camera love Warner," the official account of Pakistan Cricket tweeted sharing the video. "Some entertainment in boring dead Test match," a fan commented on the video.

235.title: Unbelievably moved: Kristen Stewart on her 1st Oscar nomination
235.article_body: Actress Kristen Stewart has said that she was unbelievably moved after receiving an Oscar nomination for her film 'Spencer'. "I am truly astounded and unbelievably moved and touched and just stunned," she stated. Kristen has been nominated in the Best Actress category for her role as Princess Diana in the film. Kristen added that she loved the film.

236.title: Pune Metro trains to get dedicated ladies' coach 'Nari Shakti'
236.article_body: Pune Metro will soon run three-coach trains with a dedicated ladies' compartment called 'Nari Shakti', said Hemant Sonawne, Public Relation Officer of Pune Metro. The coaches will be equipped with CCTV cameras, charging sockets, air conditioning and emergency buttons, which will connect a passenger directly to loco pilot and station control room. The fares will be between ₹10-₹20, Sonawne added.

237.title: Delhi's maximum temperature likely to rise up to 34°C over next 6 days
237.article_body: The maximum temperature in Delhi will see a further rise in the next six days, the India Meteorological Department has said. The temperature is likely to rise up to about 32°C on March 13 and to 34°C by the next day. IMD said that the city is likely to record a high of 30°C on Tuesday.

238.title: Bengaluru bans protests near colleges, schools till March 22 amid hijab row
238.article_body: Amid the ongoing hijab controversy, Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant has extended the ban on protests and gatherings within the 200-metre radius of schools, colleges, and other educational institutions till March 22. This is important to maintain public peace and order in Bengaluru, Pant said, adding the issue is still alive. The ban was first imposed on February 9.

239.title: Exit polls tactic to create mental pressure: RLD chief
239.article_body: Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) chief Jayant Chaudhary on Tuesday rejected exit poll predictions that said BJP will retain power in Uttar Pradesh. "I do not agree with...exit poll process," he told ANI. "The exit polls are an attempt to create mental pressure. It's a way to demoralise the people who want a change in the state," Chaudhary added.

240.title: Revenue Secy urges Customs officials to be cautious amid rise in drug hauls
240.article_body: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj on Monday urged officials of the Customs department to be cautious amid rise in drug hauls across the country. "The change in the geopolitical situation may actually see that we are getting more quantity than what we were getting earlier," Bajaj said during an investiture ceremony organised by the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs.

241.title: Rapper-YouTuber Lil Bo Weep dies aged 22, father says 'She couldn't fight anymore'
241.article_body: Australian rapper-YouTuber Lil Bo Weep has died aged 22, her father Matthew Schofield confirmed in a Facebook post. "We lost the fight for my daughter's life against depression, trauma, PTSD and drug addiction that we have been fighting since we got her back from America through emergency repatriation DFAT but broken," he wrote. "She could not fight anymore," he added.

242.title: We were all saying Ashwin is struggling, his career is probably over: Sodhi
242.article_body: Talking about Ravichandran Ashwin becoming India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket, ex-India all-rounder Reetinder Singh Sodhi said, "We were all saying that Ashwin is struggling, his career is probably over but that's not the case." "Anil Kumble has been my idol, so I'd want...Ashwin doesn't break his record [of 619 Test wickets]," added Reetinder. Ashwin has taken 436 Test wickets.

243.title: Domestic help jumps from 5th floor of building in Bandra, dies
243.article_body: A 30-year-old domestic help, Sarita Toko, jumped to her death from the fifth floor of a building in Mumbai's Bandra on Sunday. Toko hails from Jharkhand and had started working at a flat on the fifth floor last week. Her employers learnt of the incident only after a newspaper delivery person found her body in the compound, police said.

244.title: Nickel price more than doubles in a day, briefly hits $100,000 a tonne
244.article_body: Nickel price jumped as much as 111% on Tuesday to briefly surge above a record $100,000/tonne on London Metal Exchange (LME), before paring some gains. LME halted trading in nickel as brokers faced trouble in paying margin calls following the largest-ever price move on the exchange. This comes amid a rise in risk of shortages from Russia, following Ukraine's invasion.

245.title: Duplantis breaks his own pole vault world record for 2nd time in 2 years
245.article_body: Armand Duplantis of Sweden has set a new pole vault world record of 6.19 metres at the World Athletics Indoor Tour event in Belgrade, Serbia. This is the second time in two years that Duplantis has improved his own record by 1cm. In February 2020, he had broken his own record of 6.17 metres with a 6.18 metres clearance.

246.title: Geeta praises Virat for having Anushka next to him on 100th Test felicitation
246.article_body: Cricketer Harbhajan Singh's wife Geeta Basra spoke about Anushka Sharma being present on the ground when Virat Kohli was felicitated on his 100th Test match. She lauded Virat for having Anushka next to him and said he is changing rules. "It was...first time a cricketer's wife was next to her husband when he was being honoured on field," Geeta said.

247.title: 7 students from Pune district yet to return from Ukraine
247.article_body: Seven more students from Maharashtra's Pune district are yet to return from Ukraine as on Monday as three of them are in Poland, one is in Oman and three students are in transit. As many as 102 students from the district have been brought back. Pune District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh said the administration is in touch with the students.

248.title: Assam man burns wife alive for failing to meet dowry demands; held
248.article_body: A 40-year-old man allegedly burnt his wife alive in Moina in Assam's Karimganj district after her family failed to meet his demands for dowry, police said on Tuesday. The accused, Jamal Uddin, married the victim, Khudeja Begum, after his first wife left him and remarried. Begum used to live with her parents due to Uddin's dowry demands.

249.title: Shortfall of 19,128 classrooms in state-run schools: Gujarat Min
249.article_body: Responding to a set of questions raised by Congress MLAs, Gujarat Education Minister Jitu Vaghani informed the House that there was a shortfall of 19,128 classrooms in various state-run primary schools as of December 2021. The Gujarat government has also built 2,714 new classrooms during the last two years, Vaghani added. Dahod district topped the list of classrooms' shortfall.

250.title: India's economy picking up pace, reflecting reforms of our govt: PM Modi
250.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that India's economy is picking up pace after the COVID-19 pandemic and it is reflecting the fundamentals and reforms of the BJP-led Central government. "By encouraging foreign capital flows, reducing tax on infrastructure investment, creating institutions like NIIF, Gift City, new DFIs, we've tried to accelerate financial and economic growth," PM added.

251.title: Spoke to Warne 2 days before he went to Thailand, we planned to meet: Clarke
251.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Michael Clarke has said he talked to Shane Warne two days before he got on the plane for Thailand, where he died aged 52. "We spoke briefly about trying to get fit...the plan was...I would go and see him, he bought a new car, we both love cars. That's why it was an absolute shock," revealed Clarke.

252.title: Sanctions on India over Russian deal would be extraordinarily foolhardy: US politician
252.article_body: US Senator Ted Cruz responded to reports that Joe Biden-led US administration is contemplating to impose Countering America's Adversaries through Sanctions Act (CAATSA) against India over purchase of S-400 missile system from Russia. "Imposing CAATSA sanctions against India, the largest democracy on Earth...would be extraordinarily foolhardy," he said, adding that India is a critical ally.

253.title: I do therapy once a week, want to tell my younger self to relax: Alia Bhatt
253.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, in recent interview with journalist Barkha Dutt, said she goes to therapy once a week. "I am in the film industry and have been very hard on myself with regards to food and weight. I would tell my 18, 19, 20 year old self 'Just relax, put effort but don't be so hard on yourself'," she added.

254.title: Amazon's Chinese suppliers linked to forced labour camps: Report
254.article_body: Amazon's public list of Chinese suppliers includes five companies previously linked directly or indirectly to forced labour of ethnic minorities from China's Xinjiang region, Tech Transparency Project reported. The suppliers help produce Amazon-branded devices and products sold under house labels like Amazon Basics. Two of the suppliers named in the report were also reportedly used by Apple.

255.title: PMC presents draft budget of ₹8,592 cr, focus on more road networks
255.article_body: Pune Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar on Monday presented the civic body's draft budget of ₹8,592 crore for 2022-23, with a focus on creating more road networks in city. "Despite...Pune Metro being launched, we want to strengthen...public transport...Considering this, I have proposed six more...flyovers...and one bridge,” Kumar said. Many projects will be implemented via PPP model, he added.

256.title: Ashram underpass to be open from March 22: Delhi Deputy CM
256.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday said the Ashram underpass will be opened for the public from March 22 onwards. Sisodia recently also carried out an inspection of the construction site. Another underpass at Pragati Maidan will be ready for use by May while construction of the Ashram flyover will be completed by August, PTI quoted Sisodia as saying.

257.title: Huge rush of passengers on Pune Metro on 2nd day, pics surface
257.article_body: The newly operational Pune Metro witnessed a good turnout on the second day on Monday and a huge rush of people was seen in metro stations. The metro is operational on two routes-- from Garware college to Vanaz station and from Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation to Phugewadi. The facility is open to the public from 8 am to 9 pm.

258.title: Mumbai man jumps in front of train with son over joblessness; child dies
258.article_body: A Mumbai-based 32-year-old man reportedly tried to kill himself along with his three-year-old son by jumping in front of a train on Sunday. However, he survived the jump, but his son died. He was reportedly unemployed and often landed up in an argument with his wife over the same. Following this, he decided to end his life with his son.

259.title: Speeding dumper truck mows down woman on way to church in Mumbai
259.article_body: A 65-year-old woman died after a speeding dumper truck mowed her down in Mumbai's Malad on Sunday. The victim, Aliana Thomas, was on her way to the church when the incident happened. Reportedly, the driver, Mohammad Shafiq Ansari, lost control of the vehicle and hit Thomas who was walking on the roadside. She succumbed to her injuries during the treatment.

260.title: Leonardo DiCaprio donates $10 million for his grandmother's native land Ukraine
260.article_body: Hollywood actor Leonardo DiCaprio has donated $10 million to support Ukraine, which is fighting against Russia. The actor's maternal grandmother, Helene Indenbirken, was born in Odessa as Jelena Stepanovna Smirnova, as per Polish News. In 1917, she emigrated from there with her parents to Germany, where DiCaprio's mother was born.

261.title: Kuldeep Yadav released from India squad for pink-ball Test, Axar Patel returns
261.article_body: Chinaman bowler Kuldeep Yadav has been released from India squad for the pink-ball Test against Sri Lanka scheduled to take place from March 12 in Bengaluru. All-rounder Axar Patel has been added to India squad after being cleared by BCCI's medical team. Axar recently recovered from a shin injury and COVID-19.

262.title: We both went bald: Zerodha Co-founder's wife on their pic amid her chemotherapy
262.article_body: Zerodha Co-founder Nithin Kamath's wife Seema Patil, who was recently diagnosed with breast cancer and is undergoing chemotherapy, said she decided not to go for a wig as cancer's already a "taboo". "It...didn't feel right...so, we both went bald at the same time. Nithin has agreed to remain bald until my hair grows back again," she wrote, sharing their picture.

263.title: 9 killed after Russian aircraft bombed residential buildings in Sumy: Ukraine
263.article_body: At least nine people, including two children, have been killed after Russian aircraft bombed residential buildings in the Ukrainian city of Sumy on Monday night, Ukraine's State Emergency Service said. Several people have also been injured in the airstrikes in Sumy, which is near the Russian border. Russian aircraft also bombed cities in central Ukraine and destroyed buildings, officials said.

264.title: Pic shows 12-yr-old holding her crying sister while leaving mother behind in Ukraine
264.article_body: A picture showing a 12-year-old girl holding her crying sister as she waves their mother goodbye in Ukraine has surfaced online. "Alexandra, 12, holds her sister Esyea, 6, who cries as she waves at her mother Irina, while members of the Jewish community of Odessa board a bus to flee Russia's invasion of Ukraine, in Odessa, Ukraine," a journalist tweeted.

265.title: Over 75% of Amazon forest struggling to recover from wildfires, droughts: Study
265.article_body: Satellite images collected over the last two decades have found that over 75% of Amazon rainforest are likely struggling to recover from extreme climatic events like droughts, wildfires and logging among others. The study published in Nature Climate Change journal also stated that the rainforest may be nearing a "tipping point" of dieback, where the rainforest will turn to savanna.

266.title: Ukraine claims 12,000 Russian soldiers killed; 128 aircraft, 303 tanks destroyed
266.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday claimed that it has killed around 12,000 Russian soldiers since the Russian invasion began on February 24. Ukraine also claimed that its military has destroyed 303 Russian tanks and over 120 aircraft including 80 helicopters and 48 planes. It also claimed to have destroyed 1,036 armoured personnel carriers, 120 artillery systems and 56 multiple launch rocket systems.

267.title: Ukraine's 'Don't mess with our farmers' video goes viral amid war
267.article_body: A video titled 'Don't mess with Ukrainian farmers' posted by the country on its official Twitter account amid Russian invasion has gone viral. In the video, Ukrainian farmers can be seen towing away Russian defence equipment including tanks with tractors. "Probably it is a bit embarrassing for the 'greatest army of the world' to lose to Ukrainian farmers," Ukraine said.

268.title: Odisha's Ganjam district tops list with highest jobs under MGNREGA
268.article_body: Odisha's Ganjam district topped the list in providing employment under the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA). According to officials, till Monday, over 1 lakh households in the district were provided at least 100-day work in financial year 2021-22. Ganjam was followed by Rajasthan's Barmer and Nagaur, wherein 94,586 and 82,731 households respectively received work.

269.title: Man kills brother, uncle over property dispute in Kerala’s Kottayam; held
269.article_body: A 52-year-old man was arrested on Monday for allegedly killing his younger brother and their uncle during a fight over a family property dispute in Kerala’s Kottayam district, police said. According to the police, trouble surfaced in the family after the accused man got two-and-a-half acres of family property registered under his name.

270.title: Govt will keep focusing on women empowerment: PM Modi on Women's Day
270.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to extend greetings on International Women's Day and said government will keep focusing on women empowerment through its various schemes. "From financial inclusion to social security, quality healthcare to housing, education to entrepreneurship, many efforts have been made to put our Nari Shakti at the forefront of India's development," he tweeted.

271.title: Over 2,600 cases related to sexual assault pending in forensic labs: Maha Min
271.article_body: Responding to a question raised by Pradnya Satav in the Assembly, Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil said that more than 2,600 cases related to sexual assault were pending with the state forensic laboratories. As of January 2022, 1,619 cases related to sexual assault on children and 1,052 cases related to sexual assault on women were pending, the minister informed.

272.title: RBI launches 24/7 helpline 'DigiSaathi' for digital payment queries
272.article_body: The RBI has launched a 24x7 helpline for digital payments queries, DigiSaathi. The initiative will help customers address digital payments queries including cards, and the most relevant and appropriate information will be delivered as soon as possible. RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das also launched an instant payment system "UPI 123PAY" for feature phone users.

273.title: I was the only one in family rooting for a girl right from the start: Aditya
273.article_body: Singer Aditya Narayan, who recently welcomed baby girl with wife Shweta Agarwal, has named his daughter Twisha and said he was only one in the family "rooting for a girl from the start". "Twisha is a Sanskrit word. It means 'Rays Of Light'. My father's name Udit, my name Aditya and now my daughter Twisha are all light-related," he added.

274.title: We fought as hard as we could, will wait for results: Priyanka on UP exit polls
274.article_body: As exit polls predicted a return to power for BJP in UP, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Tuesday said that the Congress party will wait for the results. "We fought as hard as we could. We will wait and see the results," Gandhi added. For UP, NewsX and Republic P-Marq exit polls predicted over 200 seats for the BJP.

275.title: Ajay Devgn calls himself Veena's son, Kajol's husband in Women's Day post
275.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn took to Instagram to share a post on occasion of Women's Day on Tuesday. He shared a clip that showed his name being struck out. The clip further reads, "Veena's son, Kavita and Neelam's brother, Kajol's husband, Nysa's father." He captioned the post saying, "Thank you all for shaping me in the most wonderful way."

276.title: India has set a target of net-zero carbon emissions by 2070: PM Modi
276.article_body: Speaking at a webinar on 'Financing for Growth and Aspirational Economy', Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that India has set a target of net-zero carbon emissions by 2070. "To speed up work on this, it's necessary to accelerate environment-friendly projects," he added. "Green Financing...study of such new aspects and implementation is the need of the hour," PM stated.

277.title: Senior al-Qaeda leader killed in overnight raid in Mali: France
277.article_body: French Army on Monday announced that its forces in Mali have killed a senior regional leader of al-Qaeda in an overnight raid on February 25-26. Yahia Djouadi, a former "emir" of Al-Qaeda's Libyan operations, was responsible for finance and logistics for the group in Africa's Sahel region, French Army said, adding, the killing "once again weakens al-Qaeda's governance" in Mali.

278.title: It took so many tears & so much therapy: Anshula on her weight-loss journey
278.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor's sister Anshula Kapoor shared a post on her weight loss journey on Monday. Anshula wrote, "One of my first steps to becoming a healthier me was to acknowledge that mentally I wasn't in the best place. It took so much therapy. So many tears...It's been a two-year-long journey, and I'm still a work in progress."

279.title: Our startups can grow only when we encourage entrepreneurship: PM
279.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that our startups can grow only when we encourage entrepreneurship and focus on new business areas. "The financing sector needs to look at new futuristic ideas, innovative financing of initiatives and sustainable risk management," PM Modi added while addressing a webinar on 'Financing for Growth and Aspirational Economy'.

280.title: Cricket couple Starc, Healy bat simultaneously in respective Aus-Pak matches, fans react
280.article_body: Cricket couple Mitchell Starc and Alyssa Healy were on Tuesday batting simultaneously in their respective Australia-Pakistan matches. While Starc was batting against Pakistan in the first Test in Rawalpindi, Healy was batting against Pakistan in their Women's World Cup match. "What a coincidence," a fan tweeted, while another wrote, "It could be the very first such incident in cricketing history."

281.title: I'm the healthiest person I know & I got breast cancer: Zerodha Co-founder's wife
281.article_body: Zerodha Co-founder Nithin Kamath's wife Seema Patil has revealed in a blog that she was diagnosed with breast cancer in November 2021 despite being "the healthiest and fittest person" she knew. "The last few months...have been a blur and an emotional roller coaster. As cliché as it may sound, health really is wealth," Patil, who's Zerodha's whole-time director, wrote.

282.title: BJP will seek alliance with MGP if necessary: Goa CM Pramod Sawant
282.article_body: Ahead of the assembly election results, Goa CM Pramod Sawant said BJP is optimistic that it will win more than 22 seats, however, if the party falls short of the number, then it will seek support from the independents and Maharashtrawadi Gomantak Party (MGP). "The central BJP leadership is in talks with MGP for a post-poll alliance," Sawant told PTI.

283.title: My dad is in a tough battle: Pele's son Edinho on his fight with cancer
283.article_body: Discussing his father and Brazilian football legend Pele's fight against cancer, Edinho said, "He's in a tough battle...but my father is a fighter, just as he has been his whole life." "We're hoping that he'll recover," said Edinho. Pele is the first man to score 1,000 goals in competitive football having recorded the feat in November 1969.

284.title: RCB to announce their new captain on March 12 at Bengaluru's Church Street
284.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) will announce their new captain on March 12 at an event at Bengaluru's Church Street. "The beginning of a new era of leadership requires a BIG stage," RCB tweeted while announcing the event. RCB are the only team remaining to announce their captain for IPL 2022, which will begin on March 26.

285.title: I have saved 2,305 lives through concerts: 'Laapata' singer Palak Muchhal
285.article_body: Singer Palak Muchhal who has sung songs like 'Laapata' from 'Ek Tha Tiger' said she has saved 2,305 lives through her concerts which help raise money for heart, kidney patients. "There are still 436 kids in my list waiting to get operated," she added. "Every time I sing a life is saved..., what can be a bigger blessing," stated Palak.

286.title: Info Edge acquires 76% stake in B'luru dating app Aisle for ₹91 cr
286.article_body: Info Edge has announced that it has acquired a 76% stake in dating platform ﻿Aisle﻿ for ₹91 crore. One of early Zomato backers, Info Edge operates platforms like Naukri, Jeevansathi, 99acres, and Shiksha. Post the acquisition, Aisle Founder and CEO Able Joseph will continue to run the company with support from Info Edge's ecosystem.

287.title: A rogue individual is trying to harass me; it is fake news: Sonakshi on warrant
287.article_body: Actress Sonakshi Sinha has said reports claiming that a non-bailable warrant has been issued against her for not attending an event in Delhi after allegedly taking ₹37 lakh in advance are "fake". "This is pure fiction and work of a rogue individual trying to harass me," she added. "This man is trying to extort money from me," she further said.

288.title: Wasn't called on Kapil's show as 'The Kashmir...' has no big star: Vivek
288.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri took to Twitter to say that he and his team were not called on 'The Kapil Sharma Show' because they do not have a commercial star. "I don't get to decide who should be invited on @KapilSharmaK9 show. It's his and his producers' choice whom he wants to invite," he said in another tweet.

289.title: After India, Pakistan lose to Australia in Women's ODI World Cup
289.article_body: Pakistan suffered their second defeat in a row in the ongoing ICC Women's ODI World Cup after losing to Australia on Tuesday. Meg Lanning-led Australia won the toss and opted to bowl, restricting Pakistan to 190/6 in 50 overs. Alyssa Healy then smashed 72 off 79 balls to help her side win the match by seven wickets in 34.4 overs.

290.title: Akshay mourns the loss of his pet dog, says 'You took a part of our hearts'
290.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar and his wife Twinkle Khanna mourned the loss of their pet dog, Cleo, whom they had for 12 years. Sharing a picture with Twinkle and Cleo, Akshay wrote, "They say dogs leave paw prints on our hearts. You took a part of our hearts with you today. Rest well up there, Cleo. Will miss you."

291.title: Do something that makes an Indian uncle go 'Why is she like this?': Richa
291.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha took to Instagram to wish everyone on the occasion of International Women's Day and stated, "Do something with your life that...makes an Indian uncle go 'Why is she like this?'." "Every day is Women's Day," added Richa in her post. "Grateful for your womb and fire of life maa," read an Instagram post from Kangana Ranaut.

292.title: Cong MLA rides horse to Jharkhand Assembly on International Women's Day
292.article_body: Congress MLA Amba Prasad on Tuesday rode a horse to Jharkhand Assembly on the occasion of International Women's Day 2022. "There is Durga, Jhansi ki Rani in every woman...Parents must educate their daughters as women are doing well in every field," she said. Amba also rode a horse to the state Assembly last year on International Women's Day.

293.title: UK PM refuses to ease visa requirements for Ukrainians fleeing war
293.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson has rejected calls for the UK to ease visa requirements for Ukrainian refugees fleeing the war. "We're a...very generous country," but we want to maintain checks on who is arriving in Britain, Johnson added. The British government has been criticised for requiring refugees to first acquire a visa, leaving some Ukrainians stranded in France's Calais city.

294.title: RBI launches UPI for feature phones; transactions won't require internet
294.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has launched a UPI-based payment product for feature phones called UPI123Pay. The product will allow customers to use feature phones for almost all transactions, except scan and pay, and it doesn't need internet connection for transactions. This will help NPCI reach its goal of processing a billion transactions a day, the RBI said.

295.title: Zoe Kravitz recalls losing 'Dark Knight Rises' audition due to skin colour
295.article_body: Actress Zoe Kravitz said that she wanted to audition for a role in Christopher Nolan's film 'The Dark Knight Rises' but was rejected because she was "urban". "Being a woman of colour...being an actor and being told...that I wasn't able to read because of the colour of my skin...and word 'urban' being thrown around...that was really hard," she added.

296.title: Guj man sentenced to death for raping, murdering minor & killing her mother
296.article_body: Surat court on Monday convicted a man of raping and murdering an 11-year-old girl and killing her mother. While he was sentenced to death, his aide was given life sentence till natural death. Police had discovered her body with injury marks in bushes at Sai-fakir garden in Surat on April 6, 2018. Her mother's body was discovered three days later.

297.title: It was fire: Big B as writer Vivek Ranjit praises Abhishek's acting in Sarkar
297.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan reacted after writer Vivek Ranjit praised actor Abhishek Bachchan's performance in the film 'Sarkar'. Vivek Ranjit tweeted a picture of Abhishek from 'Sarkar' and wrote, "Abhishek in #Sarkar is my fav...in that last scene, [he] was pure [fire]...So calm yet fierce." Reacting to it, Amitabh wrote, "I shall absolutely agree with that...it was pure [fire]."

298.title: Woman mistreating aged in-laws has no right to live in their house: Delhi HC
298.article_body: The Delhi High Court has ruled that a woman has no right to live in her in-law's house if she mistreats them. A daughter-in-law can be evicted from the aged in-laws' house as they have the right to live peacefully, the court added. The court's verdict came after a woman approached High Court asking right to accommodation in matrimonial house.

299.title: Body of 21-year-old Indian student to be brought back after shelling stops in Ukraine
299.article_body: Minister of External Affairs S Jaishankar has informed Karnataka government that the body of 21-year-old Naveen Shekharappa, who was killed in shelling in Ukraine amid Russian military operations, will be brought to India once shelling stops, said Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai. Bommai added that Naveen's body was embalmed and kept in a mortuary in Ukraine.

300.title: How has Ukraine been able to stop far superior Russian army from advancing?
300.article_body: Experts have said Ukraine has been able to stop far superior Russian army from advancing because of a combination of good preparation, national solidarity and Russian mistakes. Experts added that Russia underestimated Ukrainian forces' home-turf advantage, including knowledge of terrain. Russia also failed to get ground and air forces to work alongside each other, they further said.

301.title: Pak captain Bismah's cradle celebration for daughter after fifty in Women's WC goes viral
301.article_body: Pakistan captain Bismah Maroof's cradle celebration for her six-month-old daughter after scoring fifty against Australia in Women's World Cup has gone viral. "Just second match into her comeback after childbirth and our captain scores a half-century and she dedicates it to her daughter, Fatima," Pakistan Cricket tweeted. Earlier, pictures and videos of Indian team playing with Fatima went viral.

302.title: Credit Suisse cuts India's rating to 'underweight', cites rising crude prices
302.article_body: Credit Suisse has downgraded India's rating to 'underweight' from 'overweight' in the wake of rising crude oil prices, referring to the cut as "tactical". In Asia, India is the "most vulnerable to higher oil prices, along with the Philippines", the agency noted. The downgrade comes as crude oil prices briefly hit a 14-year high on Monday amid the Russia-Ukraine war.

303.title: Over 17,400 Indians evacuated from Ukraine under Op Ganga: Govt
303.article_body: India has brought back over 17,400 citizens from war-torn Ukraine under Operation Ganga so far, the Ministry of Civil Aviation said. Two special civilian flights scheduled from Suceava are expected to bring 400 more Indians back home on March 8, the ministry added. The Government of India started evacuating Indians from Ukraine through special flights on February 22.

304.title: Guardiola and I have pushed each other to insane levels: Liverpool coach Klopp
304.article_body: With Manchester City six points ahead of them at the top of the Premier League standings, Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said the competition between the two teams is pushing them both to greatness. "City manager Pep Guardiola and I have pushed each other to insane levels in the last few years," Klopp stated. Liverpool have 63 points from 27 games.

305.title: Lashkar-e-Taiba associate held by security forces in J&K's Baramulla
305.article_body: Security forces on Monday arrested a Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) associate in Baramulla district of Jammu and Kashmir. In a joint operation, the Sopore Police along with 32 Rashtriya Rifles and 92 Battalion CRPF launched a cordon and search operation in the Rafiabad subdivision. Police also seized one AK 56 along with magazine and 30 live rounds from his possession.

306.title: Selling agarbattis to successful salon expert, meet Mita: Urban Company
306.article_body: Urban Company recently captured the inspiring story of Kolkata-based Mita in an episode of UC Impact. A single mother, Mita built her life from selling agarbattis to becoming a successful salon professional today. In the episode, she has shared how she is empowering her daughter, who is studying English Honours, undergoing air hostess training, and plans to pursue LLB.

307.title: Russian oil ban will be catastrophic, prices could hit $300 a barrel: Deputy PM
307.article_body: Russian Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak has warned that a ban on Russian oil imports by Western countries "would lead to catastrophic consequences for the global market". "The surge in prices would be unpredictable. It would be $300 per barrel if not more," he added. On Monday, Brent crude price briefly hit $139/barrel for the first time since July 2008.

308.title: Which are now world's 5 most-sanctioned countries as Russia tops list?
308.article_body: According to Castellum.AI, a global sanctions-tracking database, Russia has become the world's most-sanctioned country, with a total of 5,532 sanctions designations. It's followed by Iran, which has faced 3,616 sanctions over a decade, and Syria with 2,608 sanctions. North Korea stands fourth with 2,077 sanctions, while Venezuela stands fifth with 651 sanctions.

309.title: What are the major announcements made in Haryana Budget 2022-23?
309.article_body: In his Budget 2022-23 speech, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday proposed a budget of over ₹1.77 lakh crore. Families whose annual income is ₹1.80 lakh or below will be provided with a free basic health checkup facility once in two years, he said. Khattar announced a school health programme to screen 25 lakh school children twice a year.

310.title: Coinbase blocks 25,000 Russia-linked addresses over illicit activity
310.article_body: Cryptocurrency trading platform Coinbase has blocked over 25,000 wallet addresses related to Russian individuals or entities that it believes to be engaging in illicit activity. The company has shared these addresses with the US government to "support sanctions enforcement". The move comes just days after Coinbase CEO said the firm had no preemptive plans to ban Russian users.

311.title: Women police to head all police stations in TN's Avadi on Women's Day
311.article_body: All police stations under Tamil Nadu's Avadi Commissionerate will be headed by an all-women force on Tuesday to mark International Women's Day. "For the first time in India, all police stations in a Commissionerate will be headed by women. This initiative is to recognise, honour, celebrate and cherish the role of women in our uniformed services," a senior officer said.

312.title: Women are capable of transforming society by their strength: Rahul Gandhi
312.article_body: On the occasion of International Women's Day, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said that women are capable of transforming society by their wisdom, dedication and strength. "They must get their long-pending due. Women's Day greetings to all," Gandhi tweeted. Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi will take out an all-female march in Lucknow on the occasion.

313.title: Women are no longer just pretty faces or avenging angels: Madhuri
313.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit said there has been a "tremendous" evolution in the roles written for women, with women no longer viewed as "just pretty faces" or "avenging angels". "Women are viewed as whole people. It is fascinating to see this change," added Madhuri. "We aren't just a part of the story but we are the story," stated actress Neena Gupta.

314.title: Women rooting for each other, that’s true empowerment: Rakul Preet
314.article_body: Talking about women empowerment on the occasion of International Women's Day, actress Rakul Preet Singh said women rooting for each other is "true empowerment" in her opinion. "Women's empowerment...is when all women in some way...support and are genuinely happy with each other's accomplishments," added Rakul Preet. "When a female actor does well, it...pushes me to do...better," she stated.

315.title: Prabhas sent food to every 'Radhe...' team member down with COVID: Pooja
315.article_body: Terming actor Prabhas as very humble despite having a "huge" fanbase, actress Pooja Hegde said Prabhas sent food to every member of their film 'Radhe Shyam' who had tested positive for COVID-19. "My mother also felt happy about this lovely gesture," she added. "Jr NTR is...a perfectionist. His shots get [approved] in a single take," stated Pooja.

316.title: Muslim men allege assault in Gurugram's Sector 45, 2 booked
316.article_body: Two persons have been booked for allegedly assaulting two Muslim men outside a Sector 45 hotel in Gurugram, the police said. The victims were identified as Mohammad Azam, a madrassa teacher and Abdur Rahman, a construction worker. The victims claimed that the suspects assaulted and robbed them of their motorcycle and two mobile phones and fed Azam a "weird" powder.

317.title: Alexander Zverev placed on one-year probation for outburst against umpire
317.article_body: World number three Alexander Zverev has been put on probation for a year for smashing his racquet against the umpire's chair in Mexican Open last month. During the probation period, if Zverev receives a code violation that results in a fine for unsportsmanlike conduct, he'll be suspended from ATP events for eight weeks and fined $25,000.

318.title: Test cricket will stop if we don't play Kohli, Rohit: Aakash Chopra
318.article_body: Ex-India opener Aakash Chopra said Test cricket will stop if Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and Jasprit Bumrah do not play in matches, adding that it will "die" being already on the "ventilator". "There is no contest, there is no context, the matches get over in three days," stated Aakash. Team India's Mohali Test against Sri Lanka ended in three days.

319.title: Apple suspends advertising on App Store in Russia
319.article_body: Apple has suspended advertising on its App Store in Russia, barring developers from placing ads in search results. "No new campaigns will be eligible to run on the App Store in Russia for the duration of the suspension," Apple said in an email sent to developers. The decision comes days after the company halted product sales in Russia.

320.title: Success goes to one's head but with Big B it's different: Jhund director
320.article_body: Director Nagraj Manjule spoke about his experience of working with Amitabh Bachchan in 'Jhund'. He said, "I never knew...one day I'd make a film with Bachchan sir." "Despite having done...many movies, he continues to show extreme dedication and passion for the craft. As they say, success goes to one's head, but with Amitabh sir it is different," he added

321.title: Google may buy US firm Mandiant after Microsoft drops out: Report
321.article_body: Google is in talks to buy cybersecurity firm Mandiant, in what would be its second-biggest deal ever, after Microsoft backed out of discussions, Bloomberg reported. Microsoft pulled out of talks more than a week ago on concerns that Mandiant's businesses weren't a good enough strategic fit. The shares of Mandiant rose 16% at the close of trading on Monday.

322.title: Vaishno Devi Shrine Board files FIR against fake chopper booking sites
322.article_body: Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Shrine Board has filed an FIR with the Jammu and Kashmir Police’s cyber department against fake websites for cheating devotees on the pretext of providing tickets for chopper bookings. "Bookings can be made only on our official website or on phone application, nowhere else," Ramesh Kumar, Shrine Board CEO, said.

323.title: 2 college students in Pune robbed at knifepoint by auto driver, aides
323.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver and his aides allegedly robbed two college students at knifepoint in Pune on Sunday. The students had taken an auto to go to the private bus stand in Sangamwadi, but the driver took them to a public road near the railway gauge in Mangalwar Peth. The duo was then robbed of ₹1000 cash and ₹3,800 via PhonePe.

324.title: Rejected by Indian Army twice over height, 21-year-old student to fight for Ukraine
324.article_body: Tamil Nadu's Sainikhesh Ravichandran, a 21-year-old aerospace engineering student at National Aerospace University in Ukraine's Kharkiv, has taken up arms to fight for Ukraine against Russia. Sainikhesh, who was rejected by Indian Army twice due to his height, has reportedly joined the Georgian National Legion Paramilitary unit. His family said they had asked him to return but he refused.

325.title: CSK sign Ireland's Josh Little as net bowler for IPL 2022
325.article_body: Ireland pacer Josh Little has been roped in as a net bowler by CSK for the upcoming season of IPL. The 22-year-old has played 19 ODIs and 34 T20Is, picking 30 and 31 wickets respectively in the two formats. "Congrats to Josh, who is heading off on a development opportunity with the CSK...experience should be fantastic," said Cricket Ireland.

326.title: Go SpaceX: Kimbal on Russia's 'let US fly to space on broomsticks' remark
326.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk's brother Kimbal Musk cheered SpaceX on Twitter saying, "Go SpaceX", recting to Russia's "let US fly to space on broomsticks" remark. "I think the United States will be just fine," he added. Earlier, Elon Musk commented on a video of SpaceX launching 47 Starlink satellites into orbit, and said, "American broomstick."

327.title: Alia Bhatt to make her Hollywood debut with 'Heart of Stone'
327.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to Instagram to confirm that she will make her Hollywood debut with Netflix's international spy thriller 'Heart of Stone'. The movie will also feature 'Wonder Woman' actress Gal Gadot and '50 Shades of Grey' actor Jamie Dornan. The film will be directed by British filmmaker Tom Harper. "Mini Meryl's at it again," Arjun Kapoor commented.

328.title: Ukraine's Air Force shoots down 2 Russian aircraft over Kyiv in quick succession
328.article_body: Ukraine's Air Force has shot down two Russian aircraft over Kyiv in quick succession, The Kyiv Independent said. According to Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Valerіy Zaluzhny, Air Force hit the first plane of the Russian Federation over Kyiv at 8:30 pm. Another Russian plane was destroyed in the air battle on the city's outskirts at 9:10 pm.

329.title: Statistics of my son having autism are pretty strong: Comedian Amy Schumer
329.article_body: Comedian Amy Schumer said that the statistics of her son having autism are "pretty strong". "He's two and a half and I think they don't diagnose children until maybe six at earliest I think. You can see some signs but diagnosis doesn't come until later...I don't have a preference...You just want your kids to be healthy and happy," she added.

330.title: Pink chowki set up to help sex workers in Delhi's Shraddhanand Marg
330.article_body: Delhi Police have set up a pink police chowki at Shraddhanand Marg to empower the sex workers. "We want to help the sex workers to change profession...for that..we have decided to provide different profession courses," Kiran Sethi from GB Road's pink chowki said. "Our purpose is to provide vocational skills to women to make them employable," DCP Shweta Chauhan said.

331.title: 9 yrs ago, I defended Ukrainians' data from Russia & lost my firm: Telegram Founder
331.article_body: Russia-born Telegram Founder Pavel Durov revealed that nine years ago, when he was Russian social media giant VK's CEO, he defended private data of Ukrainians from the Russian government. "I lost my company and my home. I'd do it again without hesitation," he said amid concerns Telegram could face pressure from Russia. Users' "right to privacy is sacred", he added.

332.title: Man records over 500 naked gym members using camera hidden in coffee cup in US
332.article_body: A US man allegedly used a camera hidden in a coffee cup to film more than 500 people inside gym changing rooms. Peng Dong, 33, was arrested when a member of the Wisconsin Athletic Club found the camera. Dong told investigators that "he was only setting up his video camera to catch the person he believed was stealing his belongings".

333.title: Congress to send observers to states where assembly elections were held
333.article_body: The Congress party said on Monday that it will send observers to all the five states where assembly elections were held. This includes Punjab in-charge Harish Chaudhary and Ajay Maken, who will go to Punjab, while senior leader P Chidambaram and Karnataka Congress unit chief DK Shivakumar will head to Goa. The observers are expected to reach on Tuesday.

334.title: Morari Bapu donates ₹1.25 crore for people in Ukraine
334.article_body: Morari Bapu has taken the initiative of donating ₹1.25 crore as a means to extend help to people affected in Ukraine. Earlier, Morari Bapu's trust raised ₹19 crore for construction of Ayodhya's Ram Mandir, out of which ₹9 crore was donated by foreigners. The trust has now decided to donate ₹1.25 crore from this amount to help people in Ukraine.

335.title: Another aircraft had come in front of my plane, pilot averted head-on collision: Mamata
335.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that another aircraft had come in front of her chartered plane and it was the prompt action of the pilot that averted a head-on collision. "If the situation had continued for 10 more seconds, there would have been a head-on collision," she added. This comes two days after Mamata's chartered flight experienced mid-air turbulence.

336.title: Wait till March 10: Punjab CM Channi on exit poll predictions
336.article_body: With the exit polls predicting a win for AAP in Punjab, CM and Congress leader Charanjit Singh Channi urged the people to wait till March 10, the day when Assembly poll results will be declared. "Only boxes (EVMs) will tell what has to happen. All of you, please wait till March 10," Channi added.

337.title: CCTV footage helps independent candidate reclaim victory in TN civic polls
337.article_body: After a tie with DMK's K Subbulakshmi in Tamil Nadu urban civic polls, independent candidate R Palaniselvi questioned the draw of lots done by the Returning Officer in which Subbulakshmi was declared the winner. Palaniselvi moved the Madras High Court against the Returning Officer. On examining the CCTV footage of the counting process, the bench found Palaniselvi as the winner.

338.title: My mother-in-law dated a man 19 yrs younger than her: Rahul Mahajan
338.article_body: In a recent episode of 'Smart Jodi', contestant Rahul Mahajan said he got married secretly because he never wanted his marriage with his wife Natalya Ilina to end like his previous marriages. After a few pictures from his wedding were shown on the show, Rahul also revealed that his mother-in-law dated a guy who was 19 years younger than her.

339.title: Family said 'you are shy, don't even talk, how will you act': Actress Raashii
339.article_body: Talking about her family's reaction to her taking up acting, 'Rudra...' actress Raashii Khanna said that their first reaction was "you are so shy, you don't even talk, how will you act?" "When the trailer of Rudra came, my mother was...shocked...That's...validation I look for. My parents and my brother never gloss it up...and are my best support," she added.

340.title: Indian student in Ukraine sends pet dog to home in Rohtak with friend
340.article_body: A medical student from India, Sahil, studying in Ukraine, has reportedly sent his pet dog to his home in Rohtak before himself. Sahil sent the dog to India with his friend. He reportedly said that he would only come back to India if his pet dog comes along too. Reports said that the dog is sad without Sahil.

341.title: State govt made several efforts to contain Maoist incidents: Chhattisgarh Guv
341.article_body: Chhattisgarh Governor Anusuiya Uikey said the state government has made several efforts to contain Maoist incidents due to which development activities are reaching every part of the state. "State government's several efforts helped in effectively checking Maoist incidents. On the other hand, success has been achieved in neutralising 46 Maoists and motivating 555 ultras to surrender," Uikey added.

342.title: 5, including 8-month-old boy, charred to death in house fire in Kerala
342.article_body: Five members of a family, including an eight-month-old boy, were charred to death on Tuesday when their house caught fire in Kerala. Police said that neighbours alerted them. Attempts were made to douse the fire. However, it could not be controlled. Bikes parked at the compound of the house were also gutted in the fire.

343.title: Assam approves replacing paper ballots with EVMs in Guwahati civic polls
343.article_body: Assam Cabinet approved Guwahati Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Bill, 2022 for replacing paper ballots with EVMs in Guwahati civic polls. The decision was taken to "ensure transparency and efficiency in elections", CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said. "We took several important decisions pertaining to repealing of obsolete laws, revision of land premium rates...raising loan from NABARD," he tweeted.

344.title: Never easy for a woman to thrive in a world full of judgements: Sushmita
344.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen took to Instagram on the occasion of International Women's Day and stated that it can "never be easy" for a woman to thrive in a world full of judgements. "To teach it mercy, ah," added Sushmita in the post. "Whatever be the journey, it is beautiful to be a woman," the actress stated.

345.title: Require more women in force to tackle protests: K'taka DG
345.article_body: Karnataka DG and IGP Praveen Sood said the state police needs more women in its reserve forces. "We have witnessed...that women are at the forefront of protests in the state. During the hijab controversy, most of the protesters were women," Sood told Hindustan Times. He added, a new women battalion recently announced in the state budget will help ease workload.

346.title: Russia becomes world's most-sanctioned country
346.article_body: Russia has overtaken Iran to become the world's most-sanctioned country, days after its invasion of Ukraine. Since February 22, Russia has been the target of 2,778 new sanctions designations led by the US and European allies, bringing its total to 5,532, as per global database firm Castellum.AI. Iran has confronted 3,616 sanctions against it over the course of a decade.

347.title: Indian among foreigners to fight for Ukraine against Russia, pic surfaces
347.article_body: Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs took to Facebook to share a picture of some of the foreigners who have volunteered to fight for Ukraine against Russia. "International Legion of Defence of Ukraine is here! A group of volunteers from USA, UK, Sweden, Lithuania, Mexico and India in Kyiv," the ministry wrote.

348.title: Ranbir looks at my childhood pics and says, 'God, you're an alien': Alia
348.article_body: Speaking about her father Mahesh Bhatt calling her a "mystery", actress Alia Bhatt said, "Ranbir says that to me all the time. And this is the first time I've heard my father say it to me." "Even when Ranbir looks at my childhood photos, he says, 'Look at your eyes. God, you're an alien. What are these eyes?'," Alia said.

349.title: 114 held in illegal arms cases in Gujarat Police's special drive in Feb
