349.article_body: As many as 106 cases were lodged and 114 persons were arrested for illegal sale, smuggling, purchase, possession and production of firearms and ammunition across Gujarat in a special drive by Gujarat Police in February. The month-long drive, from February 1 to February 28, was conducted across all 33 districts of Gujarat.

350.title: Top Russian Army general killed in Ukraine
350.article_body: A top Russian Army general has been killed in fighting around Kharkiv, Ukrainian intelligence has claimed. Major General Vitaly Gerasimov, chief of staff of the 41st Army, was killed along with other senior officers. Investigative journalism agency Bellingcat said it had confirmed Gerasimov's death with a Russian source.

351.title: Zelenskyy reveals his location on Instagram, says 'I'm not hiding, not afraid of anyone'
351.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday revealed his location in Kyiv on Instagram. He put out a video from his office on Bankova Street in Kyiv, saying, "I'm not hiding. And I'm not afraid of anyone." He added, "You know we used to say, Monday is a hard day. There is war in the country, so every day is Monday."

352.title: BJP will win more seats in final results than predicted in exit polls: U'khand CM
352.article_body: Soon after the exit polls predicted an edge to BJP in the state Assembly polls, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said the party would win more seats in the final results than predicted in the exit polls. "People of Uttarakhand have shown faith in us and will form the government," Dhami added.

353.title: Czech President to award state honour to Ukraine’s Prez Zelenskyy
353.article_body: Czech Republic President Milos Zeman on Monday announced that he would award the highest state honours to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. "This is because the Ukrainian President has shown courage and bravery, and although the United States offered him an evacuation, he stayed in the capital of his country, from where he is leading its defence," Zeman said.

354.title: Russia will not send conscript soldiers to fight in Ukraine: Putin
354.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said that he will not send conscript soldiers to fight in Ukraine. "And there will be no additional call-up of reservists," he added in a televised address. "The fixed objectives are only carried out by professional servicemen. I'm sure they are guaranteeing security and peace for the Russian people in an effective manner," Putin further said.

355.title: Avalanche hits Himachal Pradesh's Rohli, roads blocked
355.article_body: An avalanche has hit Rohli (10 km ahead from Tindi towards Killar) in Lahaul and Spiti district of Himachal Pradesh, blocking roads, the State Emergency Operation Centre informed in an official statement. Around five-six vehicles are stuck between Rohli and Kadu Nallah and a police rescue team has already rushed to the spot to help people, the statement further added.

356.title: 28-year-old bodyguard shoots himself dead in Gurugram's Sector 83
356.article_body: A 28-year-old bodyguard, who worked as a personal security officer for clients of a private security agency, allegedly shot himself dead in Gurugram's Sector 83, police said. The victim's body was recovered from a forest area near his house, police added. "Preliminary investigation revealed, he wanted to be in a relationship with a woman...but it didn't work out," police stated.

357.title: Kerala Police seize drugs worth ₹1.5 cr, couple arrested
357.article_body: Kerala Police arrested a couple and seized 1.95 kg of MDMA worth ₹1.5 crore on Monday. According to police, the contraband was wrapped in a cloth and brought from Bengaluru in a bus. The couple, hailing from Muzhappilangad, was arrested from Kannur Plaza junction. Police also seized 67 grams of brown sugar and 7.5 grams of opium from the couple.

358.title: Alia is most talented, want her to play me in my biopic: Barkha Dutt
358.article_body: Journalist Barkha Dutt said that she wants actress Alia Bhatt to play her in her biopic. "I am not saying this because she just has a film out but I am saying this because I really think most talented actor is Alia Bhatt. I mean there's no question...range, the sheer range, the ease with which she plays everything," she added.

359.title: West Indies Tests are opportunity for us to prove a point: Joe Root
359.article_body: England Test captain Joe Root has said the three-Test series against West Indies is an opportunity for them to prove a point after their 0-4 defeat in the Ashes. "We know historically it's not an easy place for England to come and play...so it's something that we're very much looking forward to. It's a big challenge for us," Root stated.

360.title: Delhi's bus fleet crosses 7,000-mark for the first time
360.article_body: The national capital's bus fleet crossed 7,000-mark for the first time on Monday after Delhi's Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot inducted 100 new CNG buses and one electric bus into the city's bus fleet. Gahlot said over 30 lakh people used a public bus every day in February which is the highest daily ridership for Delhi's bus services since pandemic started.

361.title: Why should I hold 2nd position? My time has passed: Kapil Dev as Ashwin breaks his record
361.article_body: After Ravichandran Ashwin overtook him to become India's second-highest wicket-taker in Tests, Kapil Dev said, "It’s a great achievement especially from a guy who didn't get enough opportunities in...recent past." He added, "Had Ashwin got those opportunities...he would've crossed 434 much earlier. I'm happy for him...why should I hold [the second position] from him? My time has passed."

362.title: Ukraine suffers ₹77,000 crore in damage to infrastructure since Russian invasion
362.article_body: Ukraine has suffered about $10 billion (₹77,000 crore) in damage to infrastructure since Russia invaded the country, Infrastructure Minister Oleksander Kubrakov said on Monday. "The majority of damaged structures will be repaired in a year, and the most difficult ones – in two years," he added. Kubrakov further said that Russia is doing "all it can to prevent humanitarian corridors".

363.title: Last picture taken of Shane Warne shared by his friend
363.article_body: Shane Warne's friend Thomas Hall has shared the last photo taken of the late Australian cricket legend. The photo was taken at Thailand's Koh Samui, where Warne was holidaying. "Anybody that knew Shane knew his warmth, caring, his incredible sense of humour...his laugh...twinkle in his eye and that glare from those glowing, unnaturally white teeth," Hall wrote while paying tribute.

364.title: Warren Buffett among world's 5 richest people again as fortune hits $117 billion
364.article_body: Berkshire Hathaway CEO Warren Buffett's net worth has grown by over 7% this year to around $117 billion as his company's shares rallied, Bloomberg reported. The 91-year-old is now back among the world's five richest people, after falling to as low as world's 11th richest person in October. World's richest person Elon Musk's wealth has dropped by 15% this year.

365.title: Shane Warne's daughter shares pics & videos with him, says 'This can't be real life'
365.article_body: Late Australian cricketer Shane Warne's daughter Summer took to Instagram to share pictures and videos with him. She wrote, "It feels like I'm dreaming...waiting for someone to wake me up and tell me...you're okay. This can't be real life." She added, "I took our time for granted dad...I'd do anything to have more time with you on this earth."

366.title: AAP going to be national, natural replacement of Congress: Raghav Chadha
366.article_body: Following exit polls predicting AAP's majority in Punjab Assembly polls, party leader Raghav Chadha said that the party is going to be the national and natural replacement of Congress. "Exit poll results tell us that the people of Punjab have overwhelmingly voted for change...AAP is now the fastest-growing political party," Chadha said.

367.title: Harry Kane scores twice as Tottenham defeat Everton 5-0 in EPL
367.article_body: Harry Kane scored twice as Tottenham Hotspur handed Everton their third straight defeat in the Premier League. Notably, Kane's brace in their 5-0 win has moved him above Arsenal legend Thierry Henry for a sixth place on the all-time Premier League top scorers' list with 176 goals. Tottenham are placed seventh on the points table with 45 points.

368.title: KCR doesn't respect Constitution of India, wants to write his own: BJP MLA
368.article_body: BJP MLA Raghunandan Rao said Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao wants to write his own Constitution of India as the leader does not want to respect the Indian Constitution. His remark came after he and other BJP MLAs Raja Singh and Eatala Rajender were suspended from the Budget session in the Telangana Assembly.

369.title: Won't restrain BJP MLA Vijender Gupta in defamation case: Delhi HC
369.article_body: Delhi High Court on Monday refused to restrain BJP MLA Vijender Gupta from posting defamatory content on social media against Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot. "None should be prevented from expressing their opinions...on the government's transaction of business," HC added. The case pertains to the alleged irregularities in the purchase and maintenance of 1,000 low-floor DTC buses.

370.title: India reports 3,993 new COVID-19 cases, 108 deaths in last 24 hours
370.article_body: India has reported 3,993 new COVID-19 cases and 108 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 108 deaths, 49 deaths occurred during the day in the country while 59 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,15,210, and the active cases declined to 49,948.

371.title: 3 youths drown while swimming in reservoir in Pune's Daund
371.article_body: Three youths, aged 20-21, drowned in a water reservoir in Pune's Daund on Sunday, police said. "The probe so far has indicated that the three entered the water reservoir for swimming. But they got drowned," Inspector Vinod Ghuge of Daund Police Station said. The police have recovered the three bodies, and they have been sent to a hospital for post-mortem.

372.title: Free tabs only for students of classes 10-12 for now, clears Haryana govt
372.article_body: Haryana's Education Minister Kanwar Pal said the government will distribute free tablets only to students of classes 10-12 for now. Though they earlier promised to include class 8 and 9 students in the scheme, he said they would be considered later. Pal also said that tenders for tablets worth ₹620 crore have already been issued by the government.

373.title: ₹3,866 cr set aside to treat sewage in Hyd in T'gana Budget 2022-23
373.article_body: Telangana Finance Minister Harish Rao Thanneeru on Monday presented the state Budget 2022-23. Of the total ₹2,56,958 crore proposed expenditure, ₹3,866 crore will be used to treat sewage in Hyderabad. ₹1,542 crore will be spent towards the maintenance of roads in Hyderabad, Rao added. The government has set aside ₹725 crore for 'Sunkishala' drinking water project, he stated.

374.title: Troll says even Abhishek can't believe when he's offered a film, actor reacts
374.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan replied to a Twitter user who tried to troll him. The user shared a meme and took a veiled dig on the actor's career, it read, "When Abhishek gets...call from any director for a movie. You're not making a fool of me right?" Abhishek wrote with sarcasm, "Hey man! Loved your bio. 'Whatever you are...Be a good one'."

375.title: Man locks, kills wife in bathroom of rented house in Pune, booked
375.article_body: Pune Police have booked a man, Sham Dhere, for locking his wife, Ritu Dhere, in the bathroom of their house and killing her in Akurdi on Sunday. Police said that the couple was living in a rented room. Police added that woman's body was found in bathroom that had been locked from outside. Case under Section 302 has been registered.

376.title: Russia declares ceasefire in 5 Ukraine cities including Kyiv for evacuation of civilians
376.article_body: Russia on Tuesday declared a ceasefire amid the ongoing war in Ukraine from 10 am Moscow time (12.30 pm IST) to provide humanitarian corridors for the evacuation of civilians in the cities of Kyiv, Chernihiv, Sumy, Kharkiv and Mariupol, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Russia said. The development comes following the third round of talks between Russia and Ukraine.

377.title: Participation of citizens must to improve air quality: Environment Minister
377.article_body: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav stressed the importance of citizens' participation in improving air quality. "Dust management, solid waste management, open waste burning, industrial and vehicular pollution are...key factors that need to be addressed for improving air quality," he said during 'Interactive Dialogue Towards Clean Air' organised by Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM).

378.title: Fire breaks out at fireworks factory in Tamil Nadu, 1 dead
378.article_body: A fire broke out at a fireworks manufacturing unit in Virudhunagar district of Tamil Nadu on Monday. According to the district administration, one person died while another suffered burn injuries in the incident. Earlier, in January this year, four people were killed in a similar fire accident in a firecracker unit in the district.

379.title: MMB floats tender for new jetty, terminal facilities at Mumbai's Radio club
379.article_body: In a move to decongest the existing jetties at the Gateway of India, the Maharashtra Maritime Board floated a tender for the construction of a passenger jetty and terminal facilities at Mumbai's Radio club in Colaba. It is expected to cost ₹80 crore to be completed and the Central and state government will have an equal share in the expenditure.

380.title: Bengaluru sees less than 100 COVID-19 cases; positivity rate at 0.86%
380.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday reported 97 new COVID-19 cases as compared to 146 new cases reported on Sunday, according to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) data. The city also reported three coronavirus-related deaths in the last 24 hours. The daily COVID-19 positivity rate in Bengaluru dropped to 0.86% as compared to 0.9% reported on Sunday, the data showed.

381.title: Would he want break from IPL? BCB President on Shakib's request for break
381.article_body: After Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan requested pulling out of their upcoming tour of South Africa, stating that he can't play so much international cricket, BCB President Nazmul Hasan questioned Shakib's commitment to the national side. "Would he have said the same thing if he was picked in the IPL?" asked Nazmul. "It's surprising, to be honest," he added.

382.title: Ukrainian soldier proposes to his girlfriend at checkpoint amid war, video goes viral
382.article_body: A video of a Ukrainian soldier proposing to his girlfriend after stopping her at checkpoint amid war with Russia went viral. In the video, the troops can be seen questioning a group of people, who have placed their hands on a car's roof. The soldier gets down on one knee and surprises her with a ring as she turns around.

383.title: Safe corridor for our students in Ukraine's Sumy didn't materialise: India to UNSC
383.article_body: Addressing the UNSC on the humanitarian situation in Ukraine, India's UN Ambassador TS Tirumurti reiterated the urgent demand for the safe and uninterrupted passage for all civilians, including Indians stranded in Ukraine. He said India is deeply concerned that despite its repeated urgings to both Russia and Ukraine, the safe corridor for students stranded in Sumy did not materialise.

384.title: Better.com, that fired 900 staff on Zoom, plans laying off 4,000 this week: Report
384.article_body: Three months after Better.com's CEO Vishal Garg fired 900 workers on a Zoom call, the US-based mortgage company is planning to lay off around 4,000 people this week, TechCrunch reported citing sources. That is about 50% of its staff of about 8,000. Following the December layoffs, Garg apologised, saying that he "blundered the execution" and took time off.

385.title: Man tries to sodomise 8-yr-old boy in Guj, drowns him in river; held
385.article_body: A man has been arrested for forcibly drowning an eight-year-old boy in Gujarat. "He abducted the victim after luring him with promises of buying a...toy...accused then took the child to banks of Mahisagar river...tried to sodomise him...the child started crying...the accused...forcibly drowned him in the Mahisagar river," police said. Police added that the boy had gone missing on March 2.

386.title: Indian Embassy praises its driver for injured student's 700 km transit in Ukraine
386.article_body: The Indian Embassy in Ukraine has tweeted, "Kudos to Indian Embassy driver who successfully transferred Harjot over 700km from Kyiv to Bodomierz border under dangers of shelling and constraints of fuel shortage, road blocks, detours and traffic jams." Harjot, who sustained bullet injuries in Kyiv, was taken by road so that he can board an evacuation flight to return home.

387.title: Initially people used to say I don't look like a heroine: Madhuri
387.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit spoke about the time when people used to question if she can become a successful actor. Madhuri said, "People used to say that I don't look like a heroine because I was a very young girl from the Maharashtrian root, very petite." "My mother...[used to say] you do good work and you will get recognition," she added.

388.title: 5 held in Pune for kidnapping, threatening to kill youth over loan money
388.article_body: Pune Police arrested five people within four hours after they allegedly kidnapped youth from a petrol pump on Pune-Solapur highway. Police found victim had borrowed ₹20,000 from an accused and had returned ₹15,000. However, accused allegedly demanded ₹1 lakh more, which led to dispute. Accused then kidnapped victim and threatened to kill him if he did not pay ₹1 lakh.

389.title: Sisodia inaugurates health clinics in 20 Delhi government schools
389.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM and Education Minister Manish Sisodia on Monday inaugurated health clinics called Aam Aadmi School Clinics (AASC) in 20 government schools across the national capital. "An extension of the mohalla clinics...AASC will have a psychologist along with the doctor to examine and look over the mental and physical well-being of the students," Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain tweeted.

390.title: Gurugram civic body worker beats salon staff over wife's makeup, suspended
390.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) has suspended a junior engineer for allegedly beating, abusing and threatening the staff of a salon in sector 38 on Friday. The man reportedly created ruckus at the salon after his wife expressed disappointment over the makeup done by the staff. Police said the man also left the salon without paying ₹5,000 for service.

391.title: Wanted top Maoist leader Kanchan Da, his aide arrested from Assam
391.article_body: Police have arrested the most wanted and top Maoist leader Kanchan Da and his aide from Assam's Cachar district. The 72-year-old leader was arrested along with Akash Orang from the Patimara tea garden based on information the police had received, ANI reported. A laptop, mobile phone, other devices, Maoist literature and ₹3.60 lakh were recovered from them.

392.title: 4-laning of Mumbai-Goa highway to be completed by May 2023
392.article_body: Four-laning of the Mumbai-Goa highway will be completed by May 2023, said Maharashtra PWD Minister Ashok Chavan. "Over 67% of the widening work on the 11 packages have been completed. However, work on four portions between Indapur-Vadpale, Parshuram Ghat-Adavali, Adavali-Sangameshwar and Sangameshwar-Lanja is stuck," Chavan said. Work on the 471-kilometre-long project had started in 2011.

393.title: SC directs 6 banks to release ₹1,200 cr for stalled Amrapali projects
393.article_body: The Supreme Court has ordered six banks to release ₹1,200 crore before March 14 to aid the National Buildings Constructions Corporation (NBCC) in completing Amrapali's stalled projects. Bank of Baroda, the consortium's lead bank, told SC that it has already infused its share of ₹300 crore. NBCC said it'll also be conducting an independent structural audit of Amrapali's under-construction projects.

394.title: Surveys don't matter, SP will get a majority in UP: Akhilesh
394.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday dismissed pre-poll surveys that showed an edge to the BJP in the Uttar Pradesh elections. "Let them show whatever they have got. We are winning with a majority," he said. The SP-led alliance will form the next government in Uttar Pradesh with over 300 seats, Akhilesh claimed.

395.title: TMC 'goons' tried to attack my convoy: West Bengal BJP chief
395.article_body: West Bengal BJP president Sukanta Majumdar has claimed some alleged TMC "goons" tried to attack his convoy at Mathurapur in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district on Monday. "TMC still thinks that they can stop BJP by such attacks. I assure them they would fail in their attempts," Sukanta said. "We will not stop," he added.

396.title: Priyanka to lead Cong's all-female march in Lucknow tomorrow
396.article_body: The Congress will take out an all-female march in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow on International Women's Day on Tuesday. Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra will lead the march, party's national spokesperson Supriya Shrinate said on Sunday. All women office-bearers of the party and others will take part in it, Supriya said.

397.title: Poor, middle class benefitted from 'Jan Aushadhi Kendras': PM Modi
397.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said the poor and middle class have benefitted from the 'Jan Aushadhi Kendras' set up to provide generic drugs at affordable prices. He also interacted with the beneficiaries and took feedback from them. "These centres are not just government stores but are becoming solution centres for the common man," PM Modi said.

398.title: Sadikali Shihab Thangal chosen as IUML's new Kerala president
398.article_body: Syed Sadikali Shihab Thangal has been chosen as the new Kerala state president of the Indian Union Muslim League (IUML). He has also been named as the chairman of the National Political Advisory Committee of the IUML. The development comes a day after former state president Hyderali Shihab Thangal passed away at the age of 74.

399.title: Free rides on buses, i-buses for Indore women on Women's Day
399.article_body: Women in Madhya Pradesh's Indore will be allowed to travel free of cost in city buses and i-buses on the occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday. Municipal Commissioner Pratibha Pal said that "Atal Indore City Transport Services Limited is providing this gift to women for one day". Concerned officials have been instructed to provide the service to all women.

400.title: Trilogy on Shivaji Maharaj delayed due to pandemic: Nagraj
400.article_body: Filmmaker Nagraj Manjule has said his multilingual trilogy on Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj is facing delays due to the COVID-19 pandemic but has not been put on the back burner. "We lost two years...so naturally we could not take it on floors," he said. "Once everything falls into place, you will know," he added.

401.title: Filmmaker Priyadarshan felicitated with honorary doctorate: Report
401.article_body: Filmmaker Priyadarshan was reportedly conferred an honorary doctorate on Monday. He was felicitated by the Hindustan Institute of Technology and Science in Chennai. However, the filmmaker is yet to officially announce this. Priyadarshan last directed Hindi film 'Hungama 2' which premiered on an OTT platform. The film starred Shilpa Shetty and Paresh Rawal in lead roles.

402.title: Woman survives after falling from 5th floor of high-rise in Ujjain
402.article_body: A woman survived after falling from the fifth floor of a high-rise building in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain on Saturday. Sushmita Yadav had reportedly fallen on a guava tree and was rushed to hospital by some students. Yadav, who is an employee of a private company Profit-mart located in the building, is currently out of danger, according to doctors.
